title: The Supreme Court’s Declaration of Independence
summary: The court’s rejection of President Trump’s tariffs program is the latest in a series of clashes between him and Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr.

title: As Trump Considers Second Iran Attack, It Could Be Deadlier Than the First
summary: Within days of the U.S. strikes on Iran’s nuclear facilities last year, all sides agreed to a cease-fire. This time could be different.

title: A New U.S. Blockade Is Strangling Cuba
summary: An analysis of ship movements shows that the Trump administration is isolating the island at one of its most vulnerable moments.

summary: The accusation surfaced as Russia tries to re-establish its Olympics eligibility.

title: Two Sisters Died in Tahoe Area Avalanche During Trek With Friends
summary: Families and friends of the women, many from the Bay Area, confirmed their identities. The women went on regular trips to the Tahoe region and were experienced skiers, the families said.

title: Was Anyone at Fault in Sierra Nevada Avalanche Deaths?
summary: Few laws govern backcountry skiing in California. Experts say that people engage in the sport at their own risk, but guides have responsibilities to keep clients safe.

title: Why the United States Is Seeing an Ongoing Tourism Slump
summary: Last year, the U.S. was the only major destination to see a decline in international travelers. With increased scrutiny at the border, ICE violence and unpredictable policies, the new year isn’t looking better.

title: Former Prince Andrew’s Arrest Upends Royal Family’s Effort to Move Past His Scandal
summary: King Charles III’s family, long rocked by infighting and grievous losses, is facing what could be the gravest threat to its moral authority in more than a generation.

title: In Tibet, a Writer Finds Peace on a Trek to 18,000 Feet
summary: A writer grapples with the death of her sister, and the end of a marriage, during a challenging trek in Tibet.

title: India’s Hindu Right Seems Unstoppable. This City Shows How.
summary: Muslims make up a majority in Sambhal, but after deadly clashes over a mosque, they say they the arms of the state are now stifling them.

title: A Cancer Detection Test Fails in Major Study
summary: A closely watched clinical trial in Britain that screened blood for early detection of cancer did not show a reduction in later stages of the disease.

title: Lake Erie’s Storm Surges Become More Extreme
summary: Officials are designing new ways to protect the shorelines from sudden flooding and longer storm seasons.

title: Another Winter Storm Could Hit the Northeast This Weekend
summary: There’s a lot of hype, but not a lot of certainty among forecasters yet. Here are three scenarios to watch.

summary: The Supreme Court has spoken. What now?

title: He Was a Climate Activist. One Day, the F.B.I. Came Knocking.
summary: As the Trump administration cracks down on climate change activism, members of environmental groups like Extinction Rebellion fear they are being targeted.

title: Eric Dane, McSteamy on ‘Grey’s Anatomy,’ Dies at 53 After Battling ALS
summary: His breakout role came in 2006 as the handsome Dr. Mark Sloan, nicknamed McSteamy, the head of plastic surgery at a Seattle hospital. He died 10 months after announcing his A.L.S. diagnosis.

title: Long Before ‘The Pitt,’ There Was the Freedom House
summary: Freedom House Ambulance Service in Pittsburgh, a pioneer in emergency care, was largely forgotten. Now, members of Congress want to honor it.

title: Sword Strikes Playgoer During ‘Richard III’ in Berlin
summary: The German actor Lars Eidinger lost control of the weapon in the final scene of Shakespeare’s play.
